void ariaCapitalize ( aria_t  str  ) 

Capitalize the string.

This function makes the first character after a sequence of white space upper case

Parameters:
str aria_t instance

int ariaCharAt ( aria_t  str,
unsigned long int  i 
)

Get the i-th character.

This function returns the character at the position i of the stored string
The first position is 0

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
i the index
Returns:
the i-th character or EOF if limits are exceeded

unsigned long int ariaConcat ( aria_t  dst,
aria_t  str1,
aria_t  str2 
)

String concatenation.

This function concatenates str1 with str2 and puts the result in str
The buffer size of str will be increased if necessary

Parameters:
dst aria_t instance which will hold the result of the concatenation
str1 aria_t instance
str2 aria_t instance
Returns:
the length of str or 0 if the buffer could not be increased

unsigned long int ariaConcatInPlace ( aria_t  str1,
aria_t  str2 
)

String concatenation (in place).

This function concatenates str1 with str2 and keeps the result in str1
The buffer size of str1 will be increased if necessary

Parameters:
str1 aria_t instance
str2 aria_t instance
Returns:
the new length of str1 or 0 if the buffer could not be increased

unsigned long int ariaConcatInPlaceChar ( aria_t  str1,
char *  str2 
)

String concatenation (in place).

Same as ariaConcatInPlace() but taking a char* as second argument

Parameters:
str1 aria_t instance
str2 char* to be appended to the string stored int str1
Returns:
the new length of str1 or 0 if the buffer could not be increased

unsigned long int ariaConcatMany ( aria_t  str,
  ... 
)

Concatenate lots of strings.

This function concatenates all the strings given as argument and places the result in the first argument, str. The strings which are to be concatenated have to be of type char*
The last argument must be NULL

Parameters:
str aria_t instance which will hold the result
... lots of char* to be concatenated. The last one must be NULL!!
Returns:
the new length of str or 0 if the buffer could not be increased

void ariaCopy ( aria_t  str1,
aria_t  str2 
)

String copy.

This function places a copy of str2 in str1. The buffer size of str1 will be increased if necessary.

Parameters:
str1 aria_t instance
str2 aria_t instance

const char* ariaGetChar ( aria_t  str  ) 

Get a pointer to the string.

This function just calls the ARIA_STR() macro, which gives the pointer to the string It returns a const char * because you should only alter the string using the aria functions

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
Returns:
a pointer to the string

Create a aria_t instance.

Create a aria_t instance with the default maximum string length (64 chars) This value will be reajusted when needed

Returns:
aria_t instance

aria_t ariaInit2 ( unsigned long int  n  ) 

Create a aria_t instance defining the buffer size.

Create a aria_t instance defining an initial maximum string length This is only the initial maximum. This value will be reajusted when needed

Parameters:
n minimum string size (will be rounded to the next power of 2)

aria_t instance

Create and initialize a aria_t instance.

Create a aria_t instance and initialize it with a C string (char *) The buffer size will be powerup(strlen(s))

Parameters:

Returns:
aria_t instance

int ariaIsClone ( aria_t  str1,
aria_t  str2 
)

aria instance comparison

This function compares two aria instances
It returns true if both objects are exactly the same: equal strings and equal buffer size

Parameters:
str1 aria_t instance
str2 aria_t instance
Returns:
1 if the objects are equal. 0 otherwise

Returns:

unsigned long int ariaLength ( aria_t  str  ) 

Get string length.

This function just calls the ARIA_LEN() macro. It is the same as strlen(arialibGetChar(str))

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
Returns:
the length of the string (number of characters, without \0)

void ariaMakeSingleSpace ( aria_t  str  ) 

Remove extra space.

This function replaces sequences of white space with a single space. For example, "a b c d" is transformed into "a b c d"

str aria_t instance

The buffer size will be increased if necessary

str aria_t instance
s1 the substring to find
s2 the substring which will replace s1
Returns:
1 or 0 if it succeeds or fails, respectively

)

The buffer size will be increased if necessary

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
s1 the substring to find
s2 the substring which will replace s1
Returns:
the number of replaced substrings

void ariaResize ( aria_t  str  ) 

Re-calculate minimum buffer size.

This function re-calculates the minimum buffer size that is needed to keep the current string. If it is less than the currently allocated, the extra memory will be freed
This is the only way to make the buffer smaller. All the other functions will only increase its size when needed

Parameters:
str aria_t instance to be resized

void ariaReverse ( aria_t  str  ) 

String reverse.

This function reverses the string stored in str. For example, "abc" is changed to "cba".

Parameters:
str aria_t instance

aria_t  str,
unsigned long int  i 
)

This function extracts a substring from str and places it in dst

dst aria_t instance which will hold the result
str aria_t instance from which the substring will be extracted
i the size of the substring
Returns:
0 or 1 if if fails ou succeeds, respectively

unsigned long int ariaSearch ( aria_t  str,
char *  s 
)

Search for a substring.

This function searches for the first occurence of s in the string stored at str
Currently uses the KMP algorithm

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
s the substring to find
Returns:
the index of str where the match occured or ARIA_LEN(str) if s was not found

unsigned long int ariaSize ( aria_t  str  ) 

Get buffer size.

This function just calls the ARIA_SIZE() macro, which gives the ammount of currently allocated memory. In other words, it returns the length of the biggest string that is possible to store in str

Parameters:
str aria_t instance
Returns:
the size of the currently allocated string buffer

Switch upper with lower case and vice-versa.

Parameters:

int ariaUpdate ( aria_t  str,
const char *  s 
)

Store a new string in a aria instance.

This function stores the string s in the aria instance
The buffer will not be resized. If needed, it will be increased, but to make smaller (thus freeing some memory) you must call ariaResize()

Parameters:
str aria_t instance to store a new string
s char array to be stored in str
Returns:
0 or 1 if it fails or succeeds, respectively

int ariaUpdateFormat ( aria_t  str,
char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Store a new string in a aria instance according to a format.

This function stores a new string in the aria instance according to a format. The format specifiers are the following:
%s - a C null terminated string
%d - a C int
%A - a aria_t instance

An example: suppose you want to create the string "select * from t where u='x' and p='y'". Both values x and y are strings. You have one as a aria_t instance, a1, and the other as a C null terminated string, s1. The following code will do it:

ariaUpdate(str1, "select * from t where u='%A' and p='%s'", a1, s1);

Parameters:
str aria_t instance to store a new string
fmt the format string
... the remainder arguments, in the same order as they appear in fmt
Returns:
0 or 1 if it fails or succeeds, respectively

void ariaUpper ( aria_t  str  ) 

Make the string uppercase.

Parameters:
str aria_t instance

unsigned long int powerup ( unsigned long int  n  ) 

Get the next power of 2.

This function computes the smallest k, such that k is a power of 2 and k > n
If n is already a power of two, it returns 2*n

Parameters:
n integer (not a power of two)
Returns:
smallest power of 2 greater than n
